1.description: First, create the blade, which will serve as the sharp, functional edge of the knife, defining its primary purpose for cutting. This blade is positioned at the forefront of the knife, establishing its dominant shape and ensuring that it is both effective and practical for various cutting tasks.

2.description: Next, add the guard just below the blade to serve as a protective barrier for the user's hand, preventing accidental slips while using the knife. This component also enhances the structural integrity of the knife, ensuring a secure connection between the blade and the handle, thus contributing to the overall safety and functionality of the tool.

3.description: Then, attach the handle to the lower portion of the guard, ensuring it is securely fitted to provide a comfortable grip for the user. This addition is crucial as it allows for better control and maneuverability of the blade while also balancing the overall weight of the knife, enhancing its functionality and user experience.

4.description: Finally, add the butt at the end of the handle, which serves to provide a finished appearance and enhances the overall balance of the knife. This component not only completes the structure but also helps to prevent the user's hand from slipping off the handle during use, ensuring safety and comfort.
